channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Leaves and rubbish, 2nd December
item.description:
No street or pavement clean for weeks on end

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 6 trees ON HAYES LANE LONG THE BOUNDARY OF LANGLEY WOOD, 2nd December
item.description:
There are 6 trees in a row along the boundary of langley wood which are within close promimity of the house. you will be aware the house has suffered structuarl issues duwe to tree roots and we have had a tree root protection barrier installed at consederable cost. it is a condition of our insurance that the trees along are boundary which are the councils responsibility are kept pruned back . i have owned the property for over 20 years and i have never seen these trees being maintained. can you please arrnage for all these trees to be pollarded as a matter of urgency

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Lane, Park Langley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant littering and overflowing rubbish at 46 ceres road, 2nd December
item.description:
For months then residents have left their bins in the pavement, overflowing with rubbish and using the blue tops for general waste meaning the council rightfully don't empty them... The rubbish is over spilling and blowing down the street as well as attracting vermin. Foxes are constantly going through the food waste which is now attracting rats too.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ceres Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: White markings on pavements on Bermondsey Wall East, 2nd December
item.description:
Could you please let me know what these white markings are indicating opposite 146 and 144 Bermondsey Wall East. The last time there were these kinds of markings, there was a plan to plant some trees on the street, which is far too narrow and would have been too close to the front of the houses. Please could you let me know what this is indicating. We appreciate that streets need maintenance and that some kerb slabs become detached because they are not sufficiently deeply embedded and often get dislodged by heavy lorries delivering to City Cruises. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 146, Bermondsey Wall East, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
